Detailed Description

Include file for firmware-based Learning/FDB implementation.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct Fdb_s Fdb

Fdb - Forwarding Data Base Stores learned MAC addresses in a linearly expandable hash table represented as an Index Table and a MAC Table (see implementations for details) for RSTP. Tracks the RSTP state. All elements are pointers in case they need to be broken up in memory.

typedef struct FdbIndexTable_s FdbIndexTable

FdbIndexTable - FDB Index Table Hashable FDB table, contains entries that point to buckets of learned MAC addresses.

typedef struct FdbIndexTableEntry_s FdbIndexTableEntry

FdbIndexTableEntry - FDB Index Table Entry Each entry points to a bucket of learned MAC addresses in the FDB Table. Upon collision, the buckets will dynamically re-size to accommodate the new address. These entries are fully in charge of bucket geometry, thus bucket size is also tracked here.

typedef struct FdbMacTable_s FdbMacTable

FdbMacTable - FDB MAC Table This table contains the actual MAC information managed by the FDB Index Table.

Function Documentation

struct __attribute__ ( (packed)  )

FdbMacInfo - FDB MAC Info All relevant information related to a particular MAC address.

int32_t fdbDelete ( Fdb *  fdb,
MAC  mac 
)

If the FDB is empty, don't delete

Find proper bucket

Find MAC location in FDB

Shift all elements in bucket to the left

Remove end of bucket from table

int32_t fdbInsert ( Fdb *  fdb,
MAC  mac,
uint8_t  portNo,
bool  staticEntry 
)

If the FDB is full, don't insert

Find proper bucket

Set up bucket if empty

Find the proper MAC table insertion point

Shift MAC table entries if needed

There current slot is not empty. Check if there is an empty slot to the left of the insertion point.

Insert the MAC into the MAC table

Update Index Table to reflect any changes. Should be done after insertion

Finish up book-keeping
